name: blender-geonodes-ai
description: AI-powered knowledge base for Blender geometry nodes â€” search nodes, check connections, find patterns, and generate scripts from your empirically-discovered node catalog.
long_description: An MCP extension that wraps the Blender Geometry Nodes Discovery Engine. It provides tools to query a locally-built knowledge base of Blender's geometry nodes, check socket compatibility, browse verified node tree patterns, and generate complete Python scripts for Blender from natural language descriptions. The knowledge base is built by running discovery phases against your actual Blender installation, ensuring accuracy for your specific version.

tools.name: search_nodes
tools.description: Search the Blender geometry node catalog by keyword, domain, or role

tools.name: get_node_details
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific geometry node including inputs, outputs, and properties

tools.name: check_connection
tools.description: Check if two socket types can connect and what conversion (if any) is needed

tools.name: list_patterns
tools.description: List verified geometry node tree patterns (known-good recipes)

tools.name: get_pattern
tools.description: Get the full details of a specific verified node tree pattern

tools.name: generate_script
tools.description: Generate a complete Blender Python script for a geometry node tree from a natural language description

tools.name: get_kb_stats
tools.description: Get overview statistics of the knowledge base (node counts, domains, roles, coverage)

tools.name: run_discovery
tools.description: Run a discovery phase against the local Blender installation to build or update the knowledge base

project_directory.title: Project Directory
project_directory.description: Path to the blender-geonodes-ai project root containing discovery/, knowledge/, patterns/, etc.

blender_path.title: Blender Executable
blender_path.description: Path to your Blender executable (e.g., C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender 4.5\blender.exe). Required only for running discovery phases.
